entry.title: Request for guidance to create an Overview Page (OVP) in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I have a few questions about creating an Overview Page (OVP) in SAP Public Cloud:

  1. Is it possible to create an Overview Page using the Fiori Launchpad?

  2. Can an Overview Page be created using Business Application Studio (BAS), SAP Web IDE, or Visual Studio Code? Which approach is recommended for SAP Public Cloud?

I am trying to create an Overview Page and cards in a BTP trial account, but no data appears. I have followed several blog posts that describe the steps, yet I still cannot get the OVP to work. Could you please provide a step-by-step guide for creating an OVP in SAP Public Cloud and explain the required BTP configuration in detail.

Thank you very much for your help

Thanks & Regards,

entry.title: SAP MDK: Disabling button while action is running
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to disable the sync button while the sync action is running. I've tried several things, but as off now I have this rule assigned to the onPress event of the button, but it seem to be doing nothing.

Can I have some help with this? Is there any other better or easier way to disable a button while an action is running?

export default function DisableDuringSync(clientAPI) {
    
    let button = clientAPI.getControlProxy();
    //let button = pageProxy.getControl('Button0'); // tu botón

    button.setEnabled(false);
    
    let deletePromise = clientAPI.executeAction("/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/SyncStartedMessage.action");

    return deletePromise
        .then((result) => {
            
            return clientAPI.executeAction('/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/UploadOffline.action');
        })
        .then((result) => {
            return clientAPI.executeAction('/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/DownloadStartedMessage.action');
        })
        .then((result) => {
            return clientAPI.executeAction('/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/DownloadOffline.action');
        })
        .then((result) => {
            // Todas las acciones terminaron OK
            return button.setEnabled(true);
        })
        .catch(() => {
            // Si falla alguna, igualmente lo volvemos a habilitar
            return button.setEnabled(true);
        });
}

Regards

entry.title: SAP BTP Cloud Logging Service dashboard credentials changing frequently
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm working with the SAP BTP Cloud Logging Service and I've noticed that the OpenSearch dashboard credentials are changing quite frequently. 

Could someone help me understand why do these credentials change so often and Is there a way to stabilize these credentials

Any guidance or documentation links would be greatly appreciated!
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Error "Native class not defined" generated when deploying the SAP SSAM2505
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are trying to deploy SAP Service and Asset Manager 2505. The initial deployment was successful however, after scanning the application QR code, the App Update fails when the user selects “Update” in the popup

We found the related SAP KBA for this issue: https://me.sap.com/notes/0003665935 
.

After following the steps mentioned in the note we encountered a new error during deployment. I have attached a screenshot for your reference.

 

How can I resolve this issue? Could you please provide some insights or suggestions on this?

Thank you very much in advance.

Best regards,
Kingston A.

SAP HANA service for SAP BTP  , SAP Field Service Management, connector for SAP Business One

entry.title: Is it Mandatory to have Cloud foundry runtime with Business application studio
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are going to start using BAS for Fiori APPS and will be used with S/4 2023. Is it manadatory to use cloud foundry runtime instance ? In what case would we need to use CF runtime and in which case we don't neet it.
If we need to use CF runtime, what would be a good starting size ?

Thanks

entry.title: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio and SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
I closely followed the SAP blog Connect SAP Business Application Studio and SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and the end result is an "Authentication incorrect. Please check the SAP BTP destination authentication configuration." error. What other configuration is needed to connect BAS to a Public Cloud system if they are in different global BTP cockpit accounts?

Shown in the screenshot above, The BTP BAS destination is available but not able to authenticate to the public cloud system. The destination and communication system trust has been configured per the SAP blog.  Any ideas how how to enable cross-global account BAS connectivity?


 

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

entry.title: Error: Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 ()
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
Hello @Jitendra_Kansal78, 

I built a SAP MDK Mobile Application via the BAS. 
To do so I created two OData services in my ERP system and two destinations in my BTP account.

The creation of the apps via the CRUD template went well and also the deployment on Android and iOS mobile devices worked perfectly fine. 

I now saw that you can also choose to deploy the app as a Cloud Foundry web application. 
Initially the deployment is completed successfully, but then, when I open the generated link, I get this error message at the top of the main page:
Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 (); GET /nsJobViewerBAS_CRUD/job_infos/ Internal Server Error

I saw these two posts:

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/error-500-get-nsdemosampleapp-com-sap-edm-sampleservice-v2-internal-server/qaq-p/12753245
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/failed-to-initialize-application-data-service/qaq-p/12684025

But no real solution can be found there. I also tried to change the CSDL Options > select IgnoreAllAnnotations & ignoreAllReferences. but sadly it did not work for me. 

Please let me know if I should provide any details.

Best regards,

Manuel

entry.title: BAS issues - performance and space
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

recently we are facing issues with BAS. Local testing of CAP project start time is over 10 minutes, without any major changes. Also BAS space is growing rapidly over time without adding to the project. I have read troubleshooting guides for this but deleting and recreating workspace does not sound like an optimal solution. My project with all npm modules and gen files takes up to 20% yet my workspace is over 90% cappacity.

I am wondering about the root cause and any possible solution for this.

Thanks

entry.title: SmartTable not displaying value text (Text Association) in SAPUI5 app embedded in MyInbox
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

I’m fairly new to SAPUI5 development, so please excuse me if my explanation isn’t perfectly professional yet 🙂

I’m currently working on a freestyle SAPUI5 app that is embedded into MyInbox. In MyInbox, users can handle various tasks — including invoice processing tasks.

My app is displayed for those invoice tasks and shows detailed invoice data.

 

What I’m trying to do

The app first shows invoice header data, and below that, it displays different SmartTables for navigation entities such as GLAccountItems, PurchaseOrderItems, etc.

One example SmartTable looks like this:

This works fine — except for one detail:

When I show a field like CostCenter in a SmartField, I get something like this: 1234 (Development General)

But in the SmartTable, I only see: 1234

So the text description (value text) is missing in the table.

 

I’ve learned that this topic is related to Text Associations in SAPUI5 / OData.

 

 

What I found in the metadata

The metadata for the CostCenter field contains a ValueList annotation, which defines its F4 help and seems to refer to a value list entity (VL_SH_FAC_COST_CENTER😞

Picture 1

The referenced value list entity looks like this (simplified for readability):

Picture 2

From what I understand, sap:text="KTEXT" defines the link between the key (KOSTL) and its text. So I assume this is where the “Development General” text comes from when using a SmartField.

 

 

Additional metadata section (possibly related)

There’s also another annotation on the same property that I don’t fully understand:

Picture 3

Does this Common.v1.Text annotation link the CostCenter key to its text value internally? And if yes — why does it work in a SmartField but not inside a SmartTable column?

 

 

What I’ve heard

Apparently, it might be possible to override or extend metadata annotations using a custom annotation file (for example, adding or redefining the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text term).

Would this be a valid approach to make the SmartTable also display the text value (e.g., 1234 (Development General)) instead of only the key?

 

 

My question

How can I make my SmartTable display both the key and the text (using the Text Association) for fields like CostCenter — just like SmartField does?

If a custom annotation file is the right way, how exactly should it look like?

If you need additional metadata snippets, project settings, or controller code to help analyze this, I’m happy to share more details.

 

Thanks so much in advance for any help or best practices you can provide!

entry.title: Fiori Adaptation project Manage Purchase Order V2 to navigate directly to the create PO screen
entry.content:
Dear community, 

Within my company we do have the requirement to directly open the create purchase order screen from the Manage Purchase Order V2 app. However there's no semantic object and action available to do so.

 

I tried the next approach:

  • Create Adaptation project via BAS (Business Application Studio)
  • Create extension controller
  • Implement below code in the method onAfterRendering
sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        // ,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        // ,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton", {
            // metadata: {
            // 	// extension can declare the public methods
            // 	// in general methods that start with "_" are private
            // 	methods: {
            // 		publicMethod: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.Instead /*default*/
            // 		},
            // 		finalPublicMethod: {
            // 			final: true
            // 		},
            // 		onMyHook: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.After
            // 		},
            // 		couldBePrivate: {
            // 			public: false
            // 		}
            // 	}
            // },
            // // adding a private method, only accessible from this controller extension
            // _privateMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a public method, might be called from or overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // publicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding final public method, might be called from, but not overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // finalPublicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a hook method, might be called by or overridden from other controller extensions
            // // override these method does not replace the implementation, but executes after the original method
            // onMyHook: function() {},
            // // method public per default, but made private via metadata
            // couldBePrivate: function() {},
            // // this section allows to extend lifecycle hooks or override public methods of the base controller
            override: {
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
                // 	 * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onInit: function () {
                    console.log("Adaption Bart is triggered.");

                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Similar to onAfterRendering, but this hook is invoked before the controller's View is re-rendered
                // 	 * (NOT before the first rendering! onInit() is used for that one!).
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onBeforeRendering: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when the View has been rendered (so its HTML is part of the document). Post-rendering manipulations of the HTML could be done here.
                // 	 * This hook is the same one that SAPUI5 controls get after being rendered.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onAfterRendering: function () {

                    var oButton = sap.ui.getCore().byId("ui.ssuite.s2p.mm.pur.po.manage.st.s1::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::C_PurchaseOrderTP--addEntry");
                    if (oButton && typeof oButton.firePress === "function") {
                        oButton.firePress();
                    }  
     
                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when the Controller is destroyed. Use this one to free resources and finalize activities.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onExit: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	// override public method of the base controller
                // 	basePublicMethod: function() {
                // 	}
            }
        });
    }
);

The strange thing is that it's working with "Preview Application" in BAS.

But when deployed to the the S4 on-Premise (2023 FPS01) it's not working and throwing an error in the console.

Any thoughts?

Thanks in advance.

Best Regards, Bart

entry.title: External API call from CAP project in BAS
entry.content:
Hi All ,

i am trying to call external API in CAP project "API_BUSINESS_PARTNER"

i am getting  response but no data 

{"@odata.context":"$metadata#A_BusinessPartner","value":[]}".

Service.cds

using { API_BUSINESS_PARTNER as abp } from './external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER.csn';

service BusinessService {  
    entity A_BusinessPartner as projection on abp.A_BusinessPartner {
        key BusinessPartner, Customer, BusinessPartnerFullName, BusinessPartnerGrouping, BusinessPartnerUUID, OrganizationBPName1     }
}

Service.js

const cds = require('@sap/cds');
module.exports = cds.service.impl( async function() {
    const bp = await cds.connect.to('API_BUSINESS_PARTNER');    
    this.on('READ', 'A_BusinessPartner', async req => {        
        return bp.run(req.query);       
    });
})

package.json

{
  "name": "new",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A simple CAP project.",
  "dependencies": {
    "@cap-js/hana": "^2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/resilience": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/util": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap/cds": "^9",
    "express": "^4"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@cap-js/sqlite": "^2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds-serve"
  },
  "private": true,
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "API_BUSINESS_PARTNER": {
        "kind": "odata-v2",
        "model": "srv/external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER",
        "credentials": {
          "url": "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER",
          "headers": {
            "APIKey": "xBKJfJi0dg1AdpCGLYv88WVdFEEy78GP"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

 Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: Mass Upload functionality for a custom table in ADT
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m trying to create a table in ADT and  generated an app from it to input data. I also want to add a mass upload functionality using Excel. I have a few questions regarding the best approach:

  1. Can I implement the Excel upload without using BAS, by using actions in the Behavior Definition?

  2. If I use BAS, can I start with a List Report template and later add the Excel upload functionality?

Could you please guide me on how this can be achieved?

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Research and Development  ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model SAP Business Application Studio

entry.title: How to Create Destination for S/4HANA Public Cloud Using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Service?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m currently trying to connect our internal SAP BTP environment with an S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system, in order to develop Fiori applications using Business Application Studio.

As I understand it, to achieve this, I need to first register the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system in our BTP global account, and then create an appropriate Destination within the subaccount.

We have successfully completed the registration of the S/4HANA Cloud system in our BTP global account. However, we are now encountering issues when trying to create the Destination.

As far as I understand, there are two approaches to create the Destination:

  1. Manually configure the Destination
  2. Use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service (plan: api-access) to generate the Destination automatically

We are currently trying the second approach using the Extensibility service, but we are encountering an error during the service instance creation, and thus cannot proceed.

Could you please advise on how to resolve this error, or guide us on the correct way to configure the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service?

For your reference, I have attached images that show the current configuration details and the error message.

entry.title: Perform CRUD operation from SAP BTP BAS on Datasphere.
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re working on a BAS (CAPM) application and aiming to perform full CRUD operations using data from SAP Datasphere.

While we’ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, we’re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

We’d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!
